title: Aleksandar Nedović
text:
Aleksandar Nedović (<a href="Serbian%20Cyrillic%20alphabet">Cyrillic</a>: Александар Недовић; born 5 September 1978) is a <a href="Montenegro">Montenegrin</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> manager and former player. He currently manages <a href="FK%20Budu%C4%87nost%20Podgorica">FK Budućnost Podgorica</a>.
Playing career.
Club.
After starting out at <a href="FK%20Budu%C4%87nost%20Podgorica">Budućnost Podgorica</a> in the <a href="First%20League%20of%20FR%20Yugoslavia">First League of FR Yugoslavia</a>, Nedović was transferred to <a href="FK%20Partizan">Partizan</a> in the 2001 winter transfer window. He made just three league appearances for the club over the course of three and a half years, but also spent some time on loan to <a href="FK%20%C4%8Cukari%C4%8Dki">Čukarički</a> (<a href="2002%E2%80%9303%20First%20League%20of%20Serbia%20and%20Montenegro">2002</a>) and <a href="FK%20Napredak%20Kru%C5%A1evac">Napredak Kruševac</a> (<a href="2003%E2%80%9304%20First%20League%20of%20Serbia%20and%20Montenegro">2003</a>).
In the 2008 winter transfer window, Nedović moved from <a href="OFK%20Grbalj">Grbalj</a> to fellow <a href="Montenegrin%20First%20League">Montenegrin First League</a> side <a href="FK%20Rudar%20Pljevlja">Rudar Pljevlja</a>. He later also played for <a href="FK%20Lov%C4%87en">Lovćen</a> and <a href="OFK%20Bar">Bar</a>, before beginning his managerial career with <a href="OFK%20Grbalj">Grbalj</a>.
